Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_3D_sample_occlusion

The function AIL_set_3D_sample_occlusion sets the occlusion for the specified 3D sample.

void AIL_set_3D_sample_occlusion(
  H3DSAMPLE S,
  F32 occlusion
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample handle to control.
occlusion
is the amount that the sample is occluded. This is a linear floating point value from completely non-occluded (0.0) to completely occluded (1.0).

Discussion

Occlusion means the sound is completely blocked - a sound playing in another room separated by a wall, for example.

By default, samples are completely non-occluded.

On most providers, occlusions are emulated with volume control. On the EAX 2 provider, however, occlusions are performed in hardware and sound really cool (they aren't completely linear across the frequency scale - you can still faintly hear low-frequency sounds - just like the guy with the stereo upstairs). On the Fast 2D and Dolby providers, occlusions are performed using a software low-pass filter - they sound really nice.

Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C
